Questions.QuestionString: For Classic Aircraft. If DMC 2+3 failure: (Level 3)
Answers: The F/O EFIS data is lost,
The F/O EFIS data is remain avail,
The F/O EFIS and ECAM SD data is lost.

Questions.QuestionString: The PFR start recording at: (Level 2)
Answers: 3 minutes after first engine start if flight number inserted prior to first engine start,
Aircraft speed more than 80 knots if flight number doesn’t inserted prior to first engine start,
3 minutes after first engine start if flight number inserted prior to first engine start or Aircraft speed more than 80 knots if flight number doesn’t inserted prior to first engine start,

Questions.QuestionString: What are two modes of CFDS? (Level 2)
In normal configuration DMC 2 process (A321_ENHANCE): (Level 1)
Answers: PFD1, ND2 and upper ECAM display.
PFD2, ND2 and lower ECAM display.

Questions.QuestionString: The display management computers process data in order to (Level 2)
Answers: Generate codes and graphic instructions corresponding to the image to be displayed.

Questions.QuestionString: Pressing the captain PFD/ND transfer pushbutton will: (Level 2)
Answers: Interchange the Captain PFD and ND images.
Replace DMC 2 by DMC3 in control of the captain side
Interchange the Captain PFD and Lower ECAM

Questions.QuestionString: What is the meaning of “TO INHIB” a message? (Level 1)
Answers: The pilot is not allowed to flight manually.
One system operates in abnormal condition
During take off and landing, most of the warnings are inhibited to avoid distraction of the crew.

Questions.QuestionString: The flight phases are computed by the: (Level 1)
The ‘SSFDR’ power supply is available: (Level 3)
Answers: At the first engine start up and five minutes after the last engine shutdown.
Using the GND CTL pushbutton in the cockpit

Questions.QuestionString: The manual tests (system test and specific tests) can be initiated via: (Level 2)
A second failure is a failure: (Level 3)
Answers: Affecting an isolated equipment or system without affecting another one.
Of an equipment or system causing the loss of other equipment.
Cause by loss of an equipment or system resulting from a primary failure

Questions.QuestionString: Class 1 failures: (Level 3)
Answers: Require maintenance action at the next adequate opportunity
Can be left until the next scheduled maintenance check.
Are the most serious ones and require an immediate maintenance action subject to the Minimum Equipment List (MEL)

Questions.QuestionString: Type 2 systems: (Level 3)
Answers: Can memorize failures only from the last flight leg
Can memorize failures occurred in the last 64 flight legs

Questions.QuestionString: The navigation display presents: (Level 3)
The ECAM displays comprise: (Level 3)
The crew can manually transfer displays: (Level 3)
Answers: From Upper ECAM (E/W) to Lower ECAM (SD)
From SD to ND, PFD to ND and ND to PFD

Questions.QuestionString: The post flight report is made up from (Level 2)
Answers: The LAST LEG ECAM REPORT and the LAST LEG REPORT.

Questions.QuestionString: Type 3 systems: (Level 2)
Answers: Can memorize failures only from the last flight leg
Can memorize failures occurred in the last 64 flight legs

Questions.QuestionString: ECAM level 3 corresponds to (Level 1)
Answers: A configuration requiring crew monitoring only.

Questions.QuestionString: The CFDS ” system report/ test” is available: (Level 2)
What is the functions of AIDS? (Level 3)
Answers: To perform engine condition, APU condition and aircraft performance monitoring as well as trouble shooting assistance.
To record mandatory parameter of APU
To record mandatory parameter of Engine

Questions.QuestionString: Electronic instrument systems present data for the: (Level 2)
The engine and warning display presents: (Level 1)
Answers: Engine indications, fuel quantity, and Flaps/Slats position.

Questions.QuestionString: the displays in DUs can be transferred: (Level 1)
Which statement is correct? (Level 3)
Answers: Master Warning use for any Red warning, Master Caution use for level 2 amber warning
Master Warning use for any level 2 amber warning Master Caution use for Red warning,
Both Master Warning and Master Caution use for any Red warning

Questions.QuestionString: In normal configuration DMC 1 process: (Classic A/C) (Level 1)
Answers: PFD1, ND2 and upper ECAM display.
PFD1, ND1 and upper ECAM display.
PFD2, ND2 and lower ECAM display.

Questions.QuestionString: The FWC generates: (Level 1)
Answers: All warning messages and supplies the attention getters.

Questions.QuestionString: The engine parameters are indicated on? (Level 1)
Answers: The upper part of the engine warning display
The right part of the engine warning display
The lower part of the engine warning display

Questions.QuestionString: The post flight report can be printed: (Level 1)
The inputs received by the FWC are used to (Level 1)
The purpose of the digital flight data recording system (DFDRS) is: (Level 3)
Answers: To record various critical flight parameters in a solid state memory to fulfill the mandatory requirements of crash recording
To record various systems data which are sent to the ground.

Questions.QuestionString: The CFDS ” LRU identification” provides: (Level 1)
Type 1 systems: (Level 2)
Answers: Can memorize failures only from the last flight leg
Can memorize failures occurred in the last 64 flight legs

Questions.QuestionString: During flight, A/C speed <100kts, both ac bus loss (Level 2)
Answers: RAT extend but only supply the hydraulic blue.

Questions.QuestionString: If both FWC 1+2 fault (Level 2)
Answers: The Master caution light comes on
The Master Warning light comes on

Questions.QuestionString: If both SDAC 1+2 fault (Level 2)
Answers: The Master caution light comes on
The Master Warning light comes on

Questions.QuestionString: In case of main clock fault (Level 2)
Answers: CFDIU will take its own clock through GMT/DATE INIT menu
CFDIU will take clock from GPS signal

Questions.QuestionString: The ECAM spurious maintenance messages info can collect from (Level 3)
In case of stall condition detected on one engine, which report will trigger on AIDS (Level 3)
This report is generated in case of abnormal APU shutdown (Level 3)
This report is generated when excessive loads are applied to the airframe during landing (Level 3)
The EIS DMC selector switch is at the first officer 3 position (Level 1)
What is the function of ECAM? (Level 2)
Answers: To present data for Aircraft Monitoring

Questions.QuestionString: What is the color of the Master caution light? (Level 2)
The ECAM displays are:
Answers: Engine and Warning Display (E/W) and System or Status Display (S) (Level 2)
Engine and Warning Display (E/W) and Navigation Display (ND)
Engine and Warning Display (E/W) and Primary Flight Display (PFD)

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of EFIS? (Level 2)
Where is the navigation and radar information displayed? (Level 2)
Which computer generates graphics and symbols to be displayed on a display unit? (Level 2)
Are the 6 display units (DUs) identical and interchangeable? (Level 2)
Answers: No, they are identical but not interchangeable.

Questions.QuestionString: The EFIS displays are: (Level 2)
Answers: PFD: Primary Flight Display and SD: System Display
PFD: Primary Flight Display and E/W: Engine data and warning
PFD: Primary Flight Display and ND: Navigation Display

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer calculates the flight phase? (Level 2)
The ECAM highest priority of alert level is: (Level 1)
What is the highest priority of the 3 selection modes of system page presentation? (Level 2)
The warning messages are accompanied by: (Level 3)
Answers: MASTER WARNING, or a MASTER CAUTION and an aural warning.
MASTER CAUTION and an aural warning.

Questions.QuestionString: In normal configuration DMC 2 process: (Level 2)
Answers: PFD1, ND1 and upper ECAM display.
PFD1, ND2 and upper ECAM display.
PFD2, ND2 and lower ECAM display

Questions.QuestionString: The fuel on board is indicated on: (Level 2)
Answers: The upper part of the engine warning display
The right part of the engine warning display
The lower part of the engine warning display,

Questions.QuestionString: Permanent data at the bottom of the system display is: (Level 2)
Answers: Always displayed whatever the page presented.

Questions.QuestionString: The mode showing 90 degree dynamic pattern which provides the aircraft position with respect to the flight plan is the: (Level 3)
A loss of an item of equipment or system resulting from other failure is: (Level 2)
A failure, which affects an isolated item of equipment or system without affecting another one is: (Level 2)
The main functions of SDAC (System Data Acquisition Concentrator) are: (Level 3)
Answers: Data acquisition, data concentration and data digitalization.

Questions.QuestionString: The DFDR (Digital Flight Data Recorder) stores data, which the FDIU (Flight Data Interface Unit) has collected during: (Level 2)
For Enhanced Aircraft. If DMC 2+3 failure: (Level 2)
Answers: The F/O EFIS data is lost,
The F/O EFIS data is remain avail,
The F/O EFIS and ECAM SD data is lost.

Questions.QuestionString: What is corrects statement for class 1 failure? (Level 2)
Answers: Class 1 failures are the most serious ones and require an immediate maintenance action subject to the Minimum Equipment List (MEL),
Class 1 failures may have consequences if a second failure occurs. A class 1 failure must be repaired within 10 days,
Class 1 failures can be left uncorrected until the next scheduled maintenance check.

Questions.QuestionString: What is corrects statement for type 1 system? (Level 2)
Answers: The type 1 systems can memorize failures, which occurred in the last 64 flight legs,
The type 1 systems memorize only failures from the last flight leg.
The type 1 systems cannot memorize failure messages.

Questions.QuestionString: Type 3 systems: (Level 2)
Answers: Can memorize failures only from the last flight leg
Can memorize failures occurred in the last 64 flight legs

Questions.QuestionString: The FDIU sends DFDR parameters to the DMU  (Level 3)
Answers: Though an ARINC 429 bus so that they can be recorded on the DAR
Though an ARINC 429 bus so they can not be recorded on the DAR
Though an ARINC 453 bus so that they can be recorded on the DAR

Questions.QuestionString: EFIS and ECAM CRT’S: (Level 3)
Answers: Are mechanically but not electrically interchangeable
Are electrically but not mechanically interchangeable

Questions.QuestionString: The systems transmit their failure information to the CFDIU : (B2) (Level 3)
Answers: Permanently in flight and on the ground

Questions.QuestionString: Which function to initiate test for one aircraft system by CFDS menu: (B1,B2) (Level 3)
The report accessible in flight are only the: (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: Avionics status and the system report
Last leg report and the last leg ECAM report
Current leg report and the current leg ECAM report

Questions.QuestionString: In case of DMC1 or 2 failure: (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: The opposite DMC replaces the faulty one
DCM 3 has to be switches over manually

Questions.QuestionString: The EIS display switching is done: (B2) (Level 3)
Answers: Automatically only in case of failure or manually in all circumstances
Automatically or manually only in case of failure

Questions.QuestionString: The DUs send back some feedback signals to their driving DMC, The feedback information is: (Level 2)
Answers: Acknowledgment signals, DU faiure information, Critical parameter feedback signals.
DU faiure information, Critical parameter feedback signals.
No, DUs don’t send feedback information to the DMCs.

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement is correct? (Level 2)
Answers: Report 14 is generated when there is an APU auto shutdown due to a detected failure
Report 14 is generated when the ENG is started with the APU
Report 14 is generated when the ENG start failure.

Questions.QuestionString: Each DMC processes: (Level 1)
The navigation parameters displayed on: (Level 1)
You can display a class 3 fault by selecting: (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: Avionic status or system report, then class 3 faults
Last leg report, then class 3 faults

Questions.QuestionString: The purpose of the avionic status report is to: (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: Provide on ground the list of system affected by a failure during the last leg
Provide on ground the list of system fitted on the aircraft.
Provide on ground the list of system presently affected by a failure

Questions.QuestionString: The highest priority of the ECAM system display is: (Level 1)
Answers: Automatic related to the flight phase

Questions.QuestionString: Which type of systems can not memorize failure message: (Level 1)
Which is the main computer of the AIDS system: (Level 1)
In case of PFDs failed, how to read PFD parameters: (Level 1)
Answers: Must be press PFD/ND XFR pushbuttons
Mode selector ECAM/ND XFR to CAPT

Questions.QuestionString: In case of SDAC 1+2 fault: (Level 1)
In case of FWC 1+2 fault: (Level 1)
Answers: Lost of aural warnings, text messages on E/W display and attention getters

Questions.QuestionString: The emergency cancel function on the ECAM CTR panel allows: (Level 1)
Answers: Cancellation of aural warning and ECAM amber messages
Cancellation of aural warning and ECAM red warning messages

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the DFDR? (A,B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: To record parameters in a solid state memory for ground maintenance.

Questions.QuestionString: Which ECAM page displayed in cruise? (Level 1)
On which display does the warning message appear? (Level 1)
Post Flight Report can be printed: (Level 1)
The audio signal generated by: (Level 1)
Which are the main function of AIDS? (Level 1)
Answers: To recording of the mandatory flight data request by authority.
Trouble shooting the avionic computers onlyEngine condition,
APU condition and aircraft performance monitoring

Questions.QuestionString: The Post Flight Report is made from (Level 1)
Answers: The LAST LEG ECAM REPORT and LAST LEG REPORT

Questions.QuestionString: The status page can be displayed: (Level 1)
Answers: When press the STATUS key on the ECAM control panel
When INOP system more than 3 items
